newsitem.title: USA: White House's Stiglitz - 96 deficit about $109 bln.
newsitem.headline: White House's Stiglitz - 96 deficit about $109 bln.

text.p: Joseph Stiglitz, the chairman of the White House Council of Economic Advisers, said Monday that the U.S. budget deficit for fiscal 1996 ended September 30 will be "about $109 billion."
Stiglitz, speaking to reporters, confirmed an earlier report from the Congressional Budget Office which said that the range would be from $107 billion to $111 billion.
The precise amount, computed by the Treasury Department, will be released later this month.
